title: Beverly Hills Megamansion Hits Market for $75 Million
text:
A contemporary new build with a touch of space-age modernism is selling in Beverly Hills, asking $75 million, Mansion Global has learned.



It’s the second property this week to hit the market in Los Angeles’s Westside with a price tag north of $70 million. The seven-bedroom estate comes online just days after “Die Hard” filmmaker Joel Silver put his $77 million modern hacienda in Brentwood up for sale.



More: Museum-Inspired Home in Los Angeles Built for Restaurateur Michael Chow Asks $69.9M

Developer Adnan Sen of Sen Properties is behind the $75 million new construction, building it from a blank canvas over the last few years.



The resulting megamansion evokes mid-century architecture, including a curving slatted metal facade that lets streams of light into the home’s cavernous interiors, images of the home show.



At 15,605 square feet, the main mansion has enough interior space to fill a regulation hockey rink and is replete with luxury amenities. In addition to a wine cellar, movie theater and gym, the home has a sweeping master wing with dual walk-in closets and bathrooms, according to listing agents Jason Oppenheim and Davina Potratz of The Oppenheim Group.



A sweeping, backlit staircase rises through the core of the two-story house and separates the home’s various living spaces on the first floor, much of which opens up via sliding glass walls for seamless indoor-outdoor living.

The mansion and a detached two-story guest house bookend a massive swimming pool that alone takes up about one-third of the otherwise grassy backyard. The agents called it one of the “biggest and most stunning pools” in Beverly Hills.



In the same style as the main house, the two-bedroom guest accommodations span another 2,690 square feet and include a full kitchen and living room.



Sen Properties, a Beverly Hills-based firm, bought the lot in 2013 for $5.85 million, according to property records.
